availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John F. Rodgers (Anderson County, Kentucky, physician and soldier)

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky physician and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Rodgers. Father of Mary Rogers and Almira Rodgers. Physician in Anderson County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as Assistant Surgeon from September 18, 1862 to January 4, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 462.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Bridgeport, p. 42B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 111.
Find A Grave, "Dr. John Fleming Rodgers (Jun 12, 1830-Sep 14, 1902)," Memorial #9689594, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9689594 (accessed August 5, 2020).
